document.title: The Segal-Bargmann transform and the Segal-Bargmann space

para.p:
Let
=
⁢ d
m n
( x )
⁢
(
⁢ 2 π
)
-
/ n 2
d x
. For Borel measurable functions
:
f , g
→
R n
C
, when
↦ y
⁢ f
(
- x y
)
g
( y )
is integrable we define

Math.text: f * g * x = (integral _ (R ^ n))@(f * (x - y) * g * y * differential-d@(m _ n) * y)

para.p:
For
∈ f
L 1
,

Math.text: formulae@(hat@(f) * xi = F * f * xi = (integral _ (R ^ n))@(f * x * e ^ (- i * list@(xi, x)) * differential-d@(m _ n) * x), xi element-of R ^ n)

para.p:
For
∈
f , g
L 1
, for almost all
∈ x
R n
,
↦ y
⁢ f
(
- x y
)
g
( y )
is integrable, 1 footnote 1 1 footnote 1 Walter Rudin, Real and Complex Analysis, third ed., p. 170, Theorem 8.14. and using Fubini’s theorem one checks that

Math.text: widehat@(f * g) = widehat@(f) * widehat@(g)

para.p:
Let
S
be the Schwartz functions
→
R n
C
. For a multi-index
α
and
∈ ϕ S
define
:
⁢
X α
ϕ
→
R n
C
by

Math.text: X ^ alpha * phi * x = x ^ alpha * phi * x

para.p:
Define
:
⁢ Δ ϕ
→
R n
C
by

Math.text: Delta * phi * x = ((sum _ (j = 1)) ^ n)@(((partial-differential _ j) ^ 2)@(phi) * x)

para.p: One proves that

Math.text: formulae@(F * D ^ alpha = i ^ (absolute-value@(alpha)) * X ^ alpha * F, D ^ alpha * F = (- i) ^ (absolute-value@(alpha)) * F * X ^ alpha)

para.p: and

Math.text: F * Delta * phi * xi = - (absolute-value@(xi)) ^ 2 * F * phi * xi

para.p:
Parseval’s formula states that for
∈
f , g
L 2
,

Math.text: (list@(f, g)) _ (L ^ 2) = (integral _ (R ^ n))@(f * overline@(g) * differential-d@(m _ n)) = (integral _ (R ^ n))@(F * f * overline@(F * g) * differential-d@(m _ n)) = (list@(F * f, F * g)) _ (L ^ 2)

para.p: thus

Math.text: ((norm@(f)) _ (L ^ 2)) ^ 2 = (integral _ (R ^ n))@((absolute-value@(f)) ^ 2 * differential-d@(m _ n)) = (integral _ (R ^ n))@((absolute-value@(F * f)) ^ 2 * differential-d@(m _ n)) = ((norm@(F * f)) _ (L ^ 2)) ^ 2

para.p:
For
∈ z
C n
, using Cauchy’s integral theorem we obtain

Math.text: (integral _ (R ^ n))@(F * (x + i * y) * e ^ (- i * list@(xi, x)) * differential-d@(x)) = e ^ (- list@(xi, y)) * (integral _ (R ^ n))@(F * x * e ^ (- i * list@(xi, x)) * differential-d@(x))

para.p:
For
≥ t 0
and
∈ f
L 2
, define
:
⁢
H t
f
→
R n
C
by

Math.text: H _ t * f * x = (2 * pi) ^ (- n / 2) * (integral _ (R ^ n))@(widehat@(f) * xi * e ^ (- t * (absolute-value@(xi)) ^ 2) * e ^ (i * list@(xi, x)) * differential-d@(m _ n) * xi)

para.p:
For
∈ t
R
>
0
let

Math.text: formulae@(h _ t * x = (4 * pi * t) ^ (- n / 2) * e ^ (- (absolute-value@(x)) ^ 2 / (4 * t)), x element-of R ^ n)

para.p: and we calculate

Math.text: (partial-differential _ t)@(h _ t) = (4 * pi * t) ^ (- n / 2) * e ^ (- (absolute-value@(x)) ^ 2 / (4 * t)) * ((- n / (2 * t)) + (absolute-value@(x)) ^ 2 / (4 * t ^ 2)) = Delta * h _ t

para.p: which yields

Math.text: (partial-differential _ t)@(f * h _ t) = f * (partial-differential _ t)@(h _ t) = f * Delta * h _ t = Delta * f * h _ t

para.p:
The Fourier transform of
h t
is 2 footnote 2 2 footnote 2 http://individual.utoronto.ca/jordanbell/notes/stationaryphase.pdf, Theorem 2.

Math.text: (widehat@(h)) _ t * xi = (integral _ (R ^ n))@((4 * pi * t) ^ (- n / 2) * e ^ (- (absolute-value@(x)) ^ 2 / (4 * t)) * e ^ (- i * list@(xi, x)) * differential-d@(m _ n) * x)
(widehat@(h)) _ t * xi
absent = (integral _ (R ^ n))@((4 * pi * t) ^ (- n / 2) * e ^ (- (absolute-value@(x)) ^ 2 / (4 * t)) * e ^ (- i * list@(xi, x)) * differential-d@(m _ n) * x)
absent = ((4 * pi * t) ^ (- n / 2) cdot (2 * pi) ^ (- n / 2)) * (4 * pi * t) ^ (n / 2) * exponential@(- t * (absolute-value@(xi)) ^ 2)
absent = ((4 * pi * t) ^ (- n / 2) cdot (2 * pi) ^ (- n / 2)) * (4 * pi * t) ^ (n / 2) * exponential@(- t * (absolute-value@(xi)) ^ 2)
absent = (2 * pi) ^ (- n / 2) * exponential@(- t * (absolute-value@(xi)) ^ 2)
absent = (2 * pi) ^ (- n / 2) * exponential@(- t * (absolute-value@(xi)) ^ 2)

para.p:
Using
=
^
*
h t
f
⋅
^ p
t
^ f
and the Fourier inversion theorem,

Math.text: h _ t * f * x = (integral _ (R ^ n))@(widehat@(h _ t * f) * xi * e ^ (i * list@(xi, x)) * differential-d@(m _ n) * xi)
h _ t * f * x
absent = (integral _ (R ^ n))@(widehat@(h _ t * f) * xi * e ^ (i * list@(xi, x)) * differential-d@(m _ n) * xi)
absent = (integral _ (R ^ n))@((widehat@(p)) _ t * xi * widehat@(f) * xi * e ^ (i * list@(xi, x)) * differential-d@(m _ n) * xi)
absent = (integral _ (R ^ n))@((widehat@(p)) _ t * xi * widehat@(f) * xi * e ^ (i * list@(xi, x)) * differential-d@(m _ n) * xi)
absent = (integral _ (R ^ n))@((2 * pi) ^ (- n / 2) * exponential@(- t * (absolute-value@(xi)) ^ 2) * widehat@(f) * xi * e ^ (i * list@(xi, x)) * differential-d@(m _ n) * xi)
absent = (integral _ (R ^ n))@((2 * pi) ^ (- n / 2) * exponential@(- t * (absolute-value@(xi)) ^ 2) * widehat@(f) * xi * e ^ (i * list@(xi, x)) * differential-d@(m _ n) * xi)
absent = H _ t * f * x
absent = H _ t * f * x

para.p:
For
> t 0
and for
∈ z
C n
,

Math.text: H _ t * f * z = (2 * pi) ^ (- n / 2) * (integral _ (R ^ n))@(widehat@(f) * xi * e ^ (- t * (absolute-value@(xi)) ^ 2) * e ^ (i * list@(xi, z)) * differential-d@(m _ n) * xi)

para.p: and

Math.text: h _ t * z = (4 * pi * t) ^ (- n / 2) * exponential@(- ((z _ 1) ^ 2 + cdots + (z _ n) ^ 2) / (4 * t))

para.p:
It is apparent that
:
h t
→
C n
C
is holomorphic. By the dominated convergence theorem,

Math.text: ((d * H _ t * f) / (d * z _ j)) * z = (2 * pi) ^ (- n / 2) * (integral _ (R ^ n))@(widehat@(f) * xi * e ^ (- t * (absolute-value@(xi)) ^ 2) * i * xi _ j * e ^ (i * list@(xi, z)) * differential-d@(m _ n) * xi)

para.p:
and
:
⁢
H t
f
→
C n
C
is holomorphic.

section.title: 3The Segal-Bargmann transform and the Segal-Bargmann space

para.p:
Let
λ n
be Lebesgue measure on
R n
, for
> t 0
let

Math.text: omega _ t * y = t ^ (- n / 2) * e ^ (- (absolute-value@(y)) ^ 2 / (2 * t))

para.p:
and let
μ t
be the Borel measure on
=
C n
×
R n
R n
whose density with respect to
×
λ n
λ n
is
↦
+ x
⁢ i y
⁢
ω t
( y )
. We define
⁢
H t
(
C n
)
to be the set of those holomorphic functions
: F
→
C n
C
satisfying

Math.text: ((norm@(F)) _ H _ t) ^ 2 = (integral _ (C ^ n))@((absolute-value@(F)) ^ 2 * differential-d@(mu _ t)) less infinity

para.p:
and for
∈
G , H
H t
we define

Math.text: (list@(F, G)) _ H _ t = (integral _ (C ^ n))@(F * overline@(G) * differential-d@(mu _ t)) = (integral _ (R ^ n))@((integral _ (R ^ n))@(F * (x + i * y) * overline@(G * (x + i * y)) * omega _ t * y * differential-d@(y)) * differential-d@(x))

para.p:
We call
H t
the Segal-Bargmann space. It can be proved that it is a Hilbert space.

For
∈ y
R n
write
=
⁢ g
( x )
⁢
(
⁢
H t
f
)
(
+ x
⁢ i y
)
, and applying Parseval’s formula and () yields

Math.text: (integral _ (R ^ n))@((absolute-value@(H _ t * f * (x + i * y))) ^ 2 * differential-d@(m _ n) * x) = (integral _ (R ^ n))@((absolute-value@(g * x)) ^ 2 * differential-d@(m _ n) * x)
(integral _ (R ^ n))@((absolute-value@(H _ t * f * (x + i * y))) ^ 2 * differential-d@(m _ n) * x)
absent = (integral _ (R ^ n))@((absolute-value@(g * x)) ^ 2 * differential-d@(m _ n) * x)
absent = (integral _ (R ^ n))@((absolute-value@(widehat@(g) * xi)) ^ 2 * differential-d@(m _ n) * xi)
absent = (integral _ (R ^ n))@((absolute-value@(widehat@(g) * xi)) ^ 2 * differential-d@(m _ n) * xi)
absent = (integral _ (R ^ n))@((absolute-value@(e ^ (- list@(xi, y)) * widehat@(H _ t * f) * xi)) ^ 2 * differential-d@(m _ n) * xi)
absent = (integral _ (R ^ n))@((absolute-value@(e ^ (- list@(xi, y)) * widehat@(H _ t * f) * xi)) ^ 2 * differential-d@(m _ n) * xi)

para.p:
Using this with
=
^
⁢
H t
f
⁢
^ h
t
^ f
and then using Fubini’s theorem and an identity for Gaussian integrals 3 footnote 3 3 footnote 3 http://individual.utoronto.ca/jordanbell/notes/stationaryphase.pdf, Theorem 3. we get

Math.text: ((norm@(H _ t * f)) _ H _ t) ^ 2 = (integral _ (R ^ n))@((integral _ (R ^ n))@((absolute-value@(H _ t * f * (x + i * y))) ^ 2 * omega _ t * differential-d@(y)) * differential-d@(x))
((norm@(H _ t * f)) _ H _ t) ^ 2
absent = (integral _ (R ^ n))@((integral _ (R ^ n))@((absolute-value@(H _ t * f * (x + i * y))) ^ 2 * omega _ t * differential-d@(y)) * differential-d@(x))
absent = (2 * pi) ^ n * (integral _ (R ^ n))@((integral _ (R ^ n))@((absolute-value@(H _ t * f * (x + i * y))) ^ 2 * differential-d@(m _ n) * x) * omega _ t * y * differential-d@(m _ n) * y)
absent = (2 * pi) ^ n * (integral _ (R ^ n))@((integral _ (R ^ n))@((absolute-value@(H _ t * f * (x + i * y))) ^ 2 * differential-d@(m _ n) * x) * omega _ t * y * differential-d@(m _ n) * y)

absent = (2 * pi) ^ n * (integral _ (R ^ n))@((integral _ (R ^ n))@(e ^ (- 2 * list@(xi, y)) * (absolute-value@(widehat@(H _ t * f) * xi)) ^ 2 * differential-d@(m _ n) * xi) * omega _ t * y * differential-d@(m _ n) * y)

absent = (2 * pi) ^ n * (integral _ (R ^ n))@((integral _ (R ^ n))@(e ^ (- 2 * list@(xi, y)) * (absolute-value@(widehat@(H _ t * f) * xi)) ^ 2 * differential-d@(m _ n) * xi) * omega _ t * y * differential-d@(m _ n) * y)

absent = (2 * pi) ^ n * (integral _ (R ^ n))@((integral _ (R ^ n))@(e ^ (- 2 * list@(xi, y)) * (2 * pi) ^ (- n) * exponential@(- 2 * t * (absolute-value@(xi)) ^ 2) * (absolute-value@(widehat@(f) * xi)) ^ 2 * differential-d@(m _ n) * xi) * omega _ t * y * differential-d@(m _ n) * y)

absent = (2 * pi) ^ n * (integral _ (R ^ n))@((integral _ (R ^ n))@(e ^ (- 2 * list@(xi, y)) * (2 * pi) ^ (- n) * exponential@(- 2 * t * (absolute-value@(xi)) ^ 2) * (absolute-value@(widehat@(f) * xi)) ^ 2 * differential-d@(m _ n) * xi) * omega _ t * y * differential-d@(m _ n) * y)

absent = (integral _ (R ^ n))@((absolute-value@(widehat@(f) * xi)) ^ 2 * exponential@(- 2 * t * (absolute-value@(xi)) ^ 2) * t ^ (- n / 2) * (integral _ (R ^ n))@(e ^ (- 2 * list@(xi, y)) * e ^ (- (absolute-value@(y)) ^ 2 / (2 * t)) * differential-d@(m _ n) * y) * differential-d@(m _ n) * x)

absent = (integral _ (R ^ n))@((absolute-value@(widehat@(f) * xi)) ^ 2 * exponential@(- 2 * t * (absolute-value@(xi)) ^ 2) * t ^ (- n / 2) * (integral _ (R ^ n))@(e ^ (- 2 * list@(xi, y)) * e ^ (- (absolute-value@(y)) ^ 2 / (2 * t)) * differential-d@(m _ n) * y) * differential-d@(m _ n) * x)

absent = (integral _ (R ^ n))@((((absolute-value@(widehat@(f) * xi)) ^ 2 * exponential@(- 2 * t * (absolute-value@(xi)) ^ 2)) cdot exponential@(2 * t * (absolute-value@(xi)) ^ 2)) * differential-d@(m _ n) * x)

absent = (integral _ (R ^ n))@((((absolute-value@(widehat@(f) * xi)) ^ 2 * exponential@(- 2 * t * (absolute-value@(xi)) ^ 2)) cdot exponential@(2 * t * (absolute-value@(xi)) ^ 2)) * differential-d@(m _ n) * x)
absent = ((norm@(F * f)) _ (L ^ 2)) ^ 2
absent = ((norm@(F * f)) _ (L ^ 2)) ^ 2
absent = ((norm@(f)) _ (L ^ 2)) ^ 2
absent = ((norm@(f)) _ (L ^ 2)) ^ 2

para.p:
Therefore
:
H t
→
⁢
L 2
(
R n
)
⁢
H t
(
C n
)
is a linear isometry. We call
H t
the Segal-Bargmann transform. It can be proved that
H t
is a Hilbert space isomorphism. 4 footnote 4 4 footnote 4 cf. https://www.math.lsu.edu/~olafsson/pdf_files/ht.pdf

For
∈ F
H t
and
∈ z
C n
, write

Math.text: ev _ z * F = F * z

para.p: and

Math.text: T _ w * F * z = F * (z - w)

para.p:
For
∈ f
⁢
L 2
(
R n
)
and
> t 0
let
F =
⁢
H t
f
∈
⁢
H t
(
C n
)
, and for
∈ w
C n
, using

Math.text: overline@(h _ t * (w - x)) = overline@(h _ t * (x - w)) = h _ t * (x - overline@(w)) = T _ (overline@(w)) * h _ t * x

para.p: we get

Math.text: ev _ w * F = f * h _ t * w
ev _ w * F
absent = f * h _ t * w
absent = (integral _ (R ^ n))@(f * x * overline@(T _ (overline@(w)) * h _ t * x) * differential-d@(m _ n) * x)
absent = (integral _ (R ^ n))@(f * x * overline@(T _ (overline@(w)) * h _ t * x) * differential-d@(m _ n) * x)
absent = (list@(f, T _ (overline@(w)) * h _ t)) _ (L ^ 2)
absent = (list@(f, T _ (overline@(w)) * h _ t)) _ (L ^ 2)
absent = (list@(H _ t * f, H _ t * T _ (overline@(w)) * h _ t)) _ (L ^ 2)
absent = (list@(H _ t * f, H _ t * T _ (overline@(w)) * h _ t)) _ (L ^ 2)
absent = (list@(F, H _ t * T _ (overline@(w)) * h _ t)) _ (L ^ 2)
absent = (list@(F, H _ t * T _ (overline@(w)) * h _ t)) _ (L ^ 2)

para.p:
Then
↦
( w , z )
⁢
(
⁢
H t
T
¯ w
h t
)
( z )
is a reproducing kernel for the Hilbert space
H t
.
